author: Staff Reporter
text:
The police department is organising a training programme on the Immigration, Visa and Foreigners’ Registration and Tracking (IVFRT) system for persons who provide accommodation to foreigners, on March 22.

This would include owners of lodges and hotels, hospital administrators and management of schools and colleges.

Online system for registration

The online system for registering the details of foreigners such as their passport, Overseas Citizen of India card and visa details is being done at the District Police Office since November 22, 2013.

Persons who provide accommodation to foreigners, such as lodge and hotel owners, hospital administrators, school and college administrators, house owners, those who have married foreigners, those who had got married abroad and moved to the district should provide details to the police department.

For children, who were born abroad and are staying with parents/relatives and studying here, the educational institutions should submit form ‘S’, while the parent and relatives should submit form ‘C’.

Once these persons get the approval from the DPO, an user ID and password for accessing the Indian FRRO website will be issued. They can then enter details of the foreigners online.

Information to DPO

Officials said it was important that they informed the District Police Office about the foreigners.

The training programme will be held at Dhandapani Mudaliar Thirumana Mandapam for four districts – Vellore, Tiruvannamalai, Krishnagiri and Dharmapuri.

The police have asked all those who provide accommodation to foreigners to attend the programme, a press release said.
title: Police to conduct IVFRT system training tomorrow
